@description.name: @description
@description.body:
*****************************************************************

qooxdoo - the new era of web development http://qooxdoo.org Copyright: 2006 STZ-IDA, Germany, http://www.stz-ida.de License: MIT: https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT See the LICENSE file in the project's top-level directory for details. Authors: Til Schneider (til132) Jonathan Wei√ü (jonathan_rass) *

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Shows a whole meta column. This includes a {@link Header}, a {@link Pane} and the needed scroll bars. This class handles the virtual scrolling and does all the pointer event handling.

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: pane {qx.ui.table.pane.Pane} table pane to show the data
@childControl.description: table pane to show the data

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: focus-indicator {qx.ui.table.pane.FocusIndicator} shows the current focused cell

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body:
scrollbar-x {qx.ui.core.scroll.ScrollBar?qx.ui.core.scroll.NativeScrollBar}
               horizontal scrollbar widget (depends on the "qx.nativeScrollBars" setting which implementation is used)
@childControl.description: horizontal scrollbar widget (depends on the "qx.nativeScrollBars" setting which implementation is used)

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body:
scrollbar-y {qx.ui.core.scroll.ScrollBar?qx.ui.core.scroll.NativeScrollBar}
               vertical scrollbar widget (depends on the "qx.nativeScrollBars" setting which implementation is used)
@childControl.description: vertical scrollbar widget (depends on the "qx.nativeScrollBars" setting which implementation is used)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: table {qx.ui.table.Table} the table the scroller belongs to.
@param.description: the table the scroller belongs to.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {int} The minimum width a column could get in pixels.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {int} The radius of the resize region in pixels.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: (int) The number of pixels the pointer may move between pointer down and pointer up in order to count as a tap.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: (int) The mask for the horizontal scroll bar. May be combined with {@link #VERTICAL_SCROLLBAR}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: (int) The mask for the vertical scroll bar. May be combined with {@link #HORIZONTAL_SCROLLBAR}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Dispatched if the pane is scrolled horizontally

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Dispatched if the pane is scrolled vertically

@description.name: @description
@description.body: See {@link qx.ui.table.Table#cellTap}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: • See {@link qx.ui.table.Table#cellDbltap}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: See {@link qx.ui.table.Table#cellContextmenu}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Dispatched when a sortable header was tapped

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to show the horizontal scroll bar. This is a tri-state value. true means show the scroll bar; false means exclude it; null means hide it so it retains its space but doesn't show a scroll bar.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to show the vertical scroll bar

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The table pane model.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether column resize should be live. If false, during resize only a line is shown and the real resize happens when the user releases the pointer button.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the focus should moved when the pointer is moved over a cell. If false the focus is only moved on pointer taps.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to handle selections via the selection manager before setting the focus. The traditional behavior is to handle selections after setting the focus, but setting the focus means redrawing portions of the table, and some subclasses may want to modify the data to be displayed based on the selection.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the cell focus indicator should be shown

@description.name: @description
@description.body: By default, the "cellContextmenu" event is fired only when a data cell is right-clicked. It is not fired when a right-click occurs in the empty area of the table below the last data row. By turning on this property, "cellContextMenu" events will also be generated when a right-click occurs in that empty area. In such a case, row identifier in the event data will be null, so event handlers can check (row === null) to handle this case.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to reset the selection when a header cell is tapped. Since most data models do not have provisions to retain a selection after sorting, the default is to reset the selection in this case. Some data models, however, do have the capability to retain the selection, so when using those, this property should be set to false.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Interval time (in milliseconds) for the table update timer. Setting this to 0 clears the timer.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The right inset of the pane. The right inset is the maximum of the top right widget width and the scrollbar width (if visible).

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} The right inset of the pane
@return.description: The right inset of the pane

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the pane's width

@param.name: @param
@param.body: width {Integer} The pane's width
@param.description: The pane's width

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
id {String} ID of the child control. If a # is used, the id is
   the part in front of the #.
@param.description:
ID of the child control. If a # is used, the id is
   the part in front of the #.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
hash {String?undefined} If a child control name contains a #,
   all text following the # will be the hash argument.
@param.description:
If a child control name contains a #,
   all text following the # will be the hash argument.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.core.Widget} The created control or null
@return.description: The created control or null

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns whether currently a cell is editing.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} whether currently a cell is editing.
@return.description: whether currently a cell is editing.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Starts editing the currently focused cell. Does nothing if already editing, if the column is not editable, or if the cell editor for the column ascertains that the particular cell is not editable.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} whether editing was started
@return.description: whether editing was started

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Stops editing and writes the editor's value to the model.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Writes the editor's value to the model

@param.body:
cancel {Boolean ? false} Whether to also cancel
      editing before firing the 'dateEdited' event.
@param.description:
Whether to also cancel
      editing before firing the 'dateEdited' event.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Stops editing without writing the editor's value to the model.

@return.description: the model index of the column the pointer is over.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the model index of the column that should be resized when dragging starts here. Returns -1 if the pointer is in no resize region of any column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: pageX {Integer} the x position of the pointer in the page (in pixels).
@param.description: the x position of the pointer in the page (in pixels).

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} the column index.
@return.description: the column index.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the model index of the row the pointer is currently over. Returns -1 if the pointer is over the header. Returns null if the pointer is not over any column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: pageX {Integer} the pointer x position in the page.
@param.description: the pointer x position in the page.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: pageY {Integer} the pointer y position in the page.
@param.description: the pointer y position in the page.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} the model index of the row the pointer is currently over.
@return.description: the model index of the row the pointer is currently over.
